message: I have a router that's connected to the ISP internet. I have another router (TP-Link W8901N) that I'd like to configure as an access point/extender for the first router. How do I do that?

data.message: connect it through a cable, enter its homepage then uncheck "Using router as a DHCP server" in the LAN settings of your router and your good to go (Y)
also you have to change the Default gateway if they are the same

another approach without the need of lan connection 
you can configure it as wifi repeater 
put it in the middle of the distance of the area you need to cover and the router.
How to do it :
https://www.quora.com/How-can-I-setup-TP-Link-router-as-a-repeater
